q: . Back in October, The Blaze reported that Indiana Republican Congressman Mike Pence was considering stepping down from his post as House Republican Chairman in order to run for president in 2012. Similarly, Politico wrote, Mike Pence , a darling of the conservative movement, would leave the leadership job with a blunt explanation to colleagues that he can't commit to a two-year term in House leadership, a source familiar with his deliberations. Mike Pence was the winner of a presidential straw poll at the Values Voter Summit in Washington, D.C. Mike Pence edged out Mike Huckabee , former Massachusetts governor Mitt Romney , former House Speaker Newt Gingrich , and Sarah Palin .
